TEXT.id: PaiwanCh2_050_THE PENIS WHICH BECAME A MAN
TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: naizua tia Kułełułełu katua sedjeł a qalitsi.
naizoa tia Koljeljoljeljo katoa sedjelj a qalici.
S.TRANSL: There were Kułełułełu and just a penis.

S.FORM: pinatsayan anga nua kina katua kama.
pinacayan anga noa kina katoa kama.
S.TRANSL: They had been left orphans by their parents.

S.FORM: sa vaik a kisudju a sema Pakuvadavaday ti Kułełułełu, sa katsu-i azua a kisudju azua qalitsi a pinituvung.
sa vaik a kisodjo a sema Pakovadavaday ti Koljeljoljeljo, sa kaco-i azoa a kisodjo azoa qalici a pinitovong.
S.TRANSL: Kułełułełu went courting to Pakuvadavaday, and took along the penis in a container to go courting.

S.FORM: saka nu semenay, a kisełang azua qalitsi.
saka no semenay, a kiseljang azoa qalici.
S.TRANSL: When they sang, the penis sang along too.

S.FORM: saka małia, sa vaik a sema tjatjan azua maresudjusudju a tia Kułełułełu katia Muakakai katia Tjukutjuku.
saka maljia, sa vaik a sema tjatjan azoa maresodjosodjo a tia Koljeljoljeljo katia Moakakai katia Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Next day the boy- and girl-friends went to the spring- Kułełułełu and Muakakai and Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: ti Muakakai a sangasangasan, saka ti Tjukutjuku, saka ti Qalitsi, saka ti Kułełułełu a viliviliłan.
ti Moakakai a sangasangasan, saka ti Tjokotjoko, saka ti Qalici, saka ti Koljeljoljeljo a vilivililjan.
S.TRANSL: Muakakai was first, then Tjukutjuku, then Penis, and Kułełułełu last.

S.FORM: mangtjez i tjatjan; temalaw a mapułat.
mangtjez i tjatjan; temalaw a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: They got to the spring, and all dipped out water.

S.FORM: ka kiramata, patsual azua qalitsi, tjaluktjuk a pasa puzałuman.
ka kiramata, pacoal azoa qalici, tjaloktjok a pasa pozaljoman.
S.TRANSL: When they washed themselves, the penis copied the others and made a dripping noise(?) into the water.

S.FORM: madudu ti Tjukutjuku; veseqitjen tua kasiw, sa sivułuq malipat i lauz.
madodo ti Tjokotjoko; veseqitjen toa kasiw, sa sivoljoq malipat i laoz.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku was angry and hit it with a piece of wood, and threw it out of sight downhill.

S.FORM: "adadadadadada," aya ti Qalitsi.
"adadadadadada," aya ti Qalici.
S.TRANSL: “Ow ow ow,” said Penis.

S.FORM: "ari saumaqi anga," aya.
"ari saomaqi anga," aya.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, let’s go home,” they said.

S.FORM: ti Muakakai a sangasangasan, saka ti Tjukutjuku, saka ti Qalitsi, saka ti Kułełułełu a pangtjez i umaq.
ti Moakakai a sangasangasan, saka ti Tjokotjoko, saka ti Qalici, saka ti Koljeljoljeljo a pangtjez i omaq.
S.TRANSL: Muakakai was first, then Tjukutjuku, then Penis, then Kułełułełu as they got home.

S.FORM: tjara maka tjumatjumaq anga azua vavayavayan katua tia Kułełułełu katia Qalitsi.
tjara maka tjomatjomaq anga azoa vavayavayan katoa tia Koljeljoljeljo katia Qalici.
S.TRANSL: They went round by their homes, the girls and Kułełułełu and Penis.

S.FORM: mangtjez i tjumaq tia Kułełułełu katia Qalitsi.
mangtjez i tjomaq tia Koljeljoljeljo katia Qalici.
S.TRANSL: Kułełułełu and Penis got home.

S.FORM: "nakuya sun; masiaq itjen.
"nakoya son; masiaq itjen.
S.TRANSL: “You’re bad. It was embarrassing for us.

S.FORM: su djungusen sakamaya tua tja sudju.
so djongosen sakamaya toa tja sodjo.
S.TRANSL: You were getting close to(?) our girl-friends.

S.FORM: 'kaituvutuvungu,' nu ku su ayain, inika sun a kilangda."
'kaitovotovongo,' no ko so ayain, inika son a kilangda."
S.TRANSL: Although I said to you, ‘Stay in the container,’ you didn’t listen to me.”

S.FORM: "ari nu maya, sałazuki," aya ti Qalitsi tjai Kułełułełu.
"ari no maya, saljazoki," aya ti Qalici tjai Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: “Oh well, come on; let’s go to the plains,” said Penis to Kułełułełu.

S.FORM: "ari nu maya," ayain; sa pangtjez i łazuk.
"ari no maya," ayain; sa pangtjez i ljazok.
S.TRANSL: “All right, let’s go,” he replied. So they reached the plains.

S.FORM: sa "anema su katjenglayan, uła tjen a sema tsiam?"
sa "anema so katjenglayan, olja tjen a sema ciam?"
S.TRANSL: “If we go to the shop, what do you fancy?”

S.FORM: "avan a tsiqaw katua ngiaw a ku katjenglayan."
"avan a ciqaw katoa ngiaw a ko katjenglayan."
S.TRANSL: “I fancy a fish and a cat.”

S.FORM: saka amin nu velin.
saka amin no velin.
S.TRANSL: So that’s all they bought.

S.FORM: sa vaik, sa pangtjez i umaq.
sa vaik, sa pangtjez i omaq.
S.TRANSL: They left and got back home.

S.FORM: "pasa puzayazayanu aken i tavi, sa pasazua-i uta azua ngiaw katua tsiqaw."
"pasa pozayazayano aken i tavi, sa pasazoa-i ota azoa ngiaw katoa ciqaw."
S.TRANSL: “Put me in the inner part of the house on the shelf, and put the cat and the fish there too.”

S.FORM: manu kikulat anan nua ngiaw, sa kasalisalitj a maka tua djui nua tsiqaw a qalitsi.
mano kikolat anan noa ngiaw, sa kasalisalitj a maka toa djoi noa ciqaw a qalici.
S.TRANSL: The cat kept frisking about(?), and the penis was tossed between the fins of the fish.

S.FORM: manu magutsal, manu metsautsau, saka ti Pułałułałuyan a ngadan.
mano magocal, mano mecaocao, saka ti Poljaljoljaljoyan a ngadan.
S.TRANSL: And it burst open and turned into a person, whose name was Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: "kełu anga, kaka.
"keljo anga, kaka.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, brother,

S.FORM: idan a ku situngan."
idan a ko sitongan."
S.TRANSL: give me some clothes.”

S.FORM: manu mingtjus ti Kułełułełu.
mano mingtjos ti Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: Kułełułełu was startled.

S.FORM: "aku izuanga tsa ku saladj?" aya.
"ako izoanga ca ko saladj?" aya.
S.TRANSL: “Why have I now got this companion?” he said.

S.FORM: manu namagutsal anga azua qalitsi, sa kalevanga ti Kułełułełu sakamaya; sa pałungpavi anga, sa pazangaqi anga.
mano namagocal anga azoa qalici, sa kalevanga ti Koljeljoljeljo sakamaya; sa paljongpavi anga, sa pazangaqi anga.
S.TRANSL: Well the penis had burst open, and Kułełułełu was very pleased. And he put on him a robe and a necklace.

S.FORM: "ari tsasavi anga sema saułaułay a qemiladj a mapapaw ḍusa; uła łemengłeng tia Muakakai kati Tjukutjuku."
"ari casavi anga sema saoljaoljay a qemiladj a mapapaw drosa; olja ljemengljeng tia Moakakai kati Tjokotjoko."
S.TRANSL: “Come on, let’s go outside to the seats in the courtyard and sit there side by side; so that Muakakai and Tjukutjuku can see us.”

S.FORM: manu łengłengen ni Tjukutjuku.
mano ljengljengen ni Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: So Tjukutjuku saw them.

S.FORM: "tsasavu, kina," aya.
"casavo, kina," aya.
S.TRANSL: “Go outside, mother,” she said.

S.FORM: sa tsasaw a kina.
sa casaw a kina.
S.TRANSL: Mother went out.

S.FORM: "sa-u, kina, pałiłii azua i Vavuluvulungan ki tima zua qałaqała."
"sa-o, kina, paljiljii azoa i Vavolovolongan ki tima zoa qaljaqalja."
S.TRANSL: “Mother, go and see who the visitor is at the Vavuluvulungan house.”

S.FORM: manu sa sazua kina, sa pangtjez i Pakuvadavaday azua kina.
mano sa sazoa kina, sa pangtjez i Pakovadavaday azoa kina.
S.TRANSL: So mother went there, and she came back to the Pakuvadavaday house.

S.FORM: "qadjaw ki tima; ika ken a kemłang."
"qadjaw ki tima; ika ken a kemljang."
S.TRANSL: “I don’t know who it is. I don’t know him.”

S.FORM: "sa-u; 'idu,' aya-u, kina."
"sa-o; 'ido,' aya-o, kina."
S.TRANSL: “Go and tell him to come here, mother.”

S.FORM: vaik a kina; djemałun i Vavuluvulungan.
vaik a kina; djemaljon i Vavolovolongan.
S.TRANSL: Mother went, and reached the Vavuluvulungan house.

S.FORM: "ari, ła maḍusa, kivangavangi a sema tjanuamen," ayain.
"ari, lja madrosa, kivangavangi a sema tjanoamen," ayain.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, you two, come for a visit to our house,” she said to them.

S.FORM: manu "uaa, masiaq amen.
mano "oaa, masiaq amen.
S.TRANSL: “Well, we’re ashamed to;

S.FORM: singidan tazua nu san tjautsiketsikel tjanuamen," aya ti Pułałułałuyan.
singidan tazoa no san tjaocikecikel tjanoamen," aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: when was it that (or it’s not long since) you insulted(?) us?” said Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: sa vaik anga azua kina; mangtjez i Pakuvadavaday.
sa vaik anga azoa kina; mangtjez i Pakovadavaday.
S.TRANSL: So mother left, and arrived at the Pakuvadavaday house.

S.FORM: "inika ui.
"inika oi.
S.TRANSL: “They don’t agree.

S.FORM: 'masiaq amen.
'masiaq amen.
S.TRANSL: They say: ‘We’re ashamed;

S.FORM: ika magału a nu san tjautsiketsikel,' aya, ła ku ałak."
ika magaljo a no san tjaocikecikel,' aya, lja ko aljak."
S.TRANSL: it wasn’t kind the way you insulted us,’ my child.”

S.FORM: "ki maya avan anga azua qalitsi makełang," aya małavar azua mareałaałak.
"ki maya avan anga azoa qalici makeljang," aya maljavar azoa marealjaaljak.
S.TRANSL: “I suppose it must be that penis,” said the mother and children to one another.

S.FORM: "sa-u, łiłi-u, Lavułivułian, uła ken a puvavulungan."
"sa-o, ljilji-o, Lavoljivoljian, olja ken a povavolongan."
S.TRANSL: “Go and pay a visit, Lavułivułian (or go-between OA), so that I can marry without a betrothal present (or so that I can get into the Vavulungan household?).”

S.FORM: vaik ti sa Lavułian; mangtjez i Vavuluvulungan.
vaik ti sa Lavoljian; mangtjez i Vavolovolongan.
S.TRANSL: Lavułian went and reached the Vavuluvulungan house.

S.FORM: "aku a mangtjez sun, vuvu?" aya ti Pułałułałuyan.
"ako a mangtjez son, vovo?" aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “Why have you come, granny?” said Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: "'sa-u, łiłi-u,' aya ti Tjukutjuku, 'uła ken a puvavulungan,' aya; avanu ku sisamaza."
"'sa-o, ljilji-o,' aya ti Tjokotjoko, 'olja ken a povavolongan,' aya; avano ko sisamaza."
S.TRANSL: “Tjukutjuku said: ‘Go and pay a visit, so that I can marry without a betrothal present.’ That’s why I’ve come.”

S.FORM: "ala iru ka ken a pukaui.
"ala iro ka ken a pokaoi.
S.TRANSL: “But I certainly won’t agree.

S.FORM: ika magału a nu tjautsiketsikel," aya ti Pułałułałuyan.
ika magaljo a no tjaocikecikel," aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Your insults were not kind,” said Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: sa vaik (ti) sa Lavułian.
sa vaik (ti) sa Lavoljian.
S.TRANSL: So Lavułian left,

S.FORM: mangtjez i Pakuvadavaday.
mangtjez i Pakovadavaday.
S.TRANSL: and reached the Pakuvadavaday house.

S.FORM: "ua, inika pukaui, łałak."
"oa, inika pokaoi, ljaljak."
S.TRANSL: “Well, they don’t agree, child.”

S.FORM: "sa-u sakamaya, vuvu.
"sa-o sakamaya, vovo.
S.TRANSL: “Go anyway, granny.

S.FORM: ku tjukuyavaw anga tua levut a ḍiḍi tu lima."
ko tjokoyavaw anga toa levot a dridri to lima."
S.TRANSL: I’ll give five white pigs in compensation.”

S.FORM: vaik ti sa Lavułian a sema Vavuluvulungan.
vaik ti sa Lavoljian a sema Vavolovolongan.
S.TRANSL: Lavułian went to the Vavuluvulungan house.

S.FORM: "'ku tjukuyavaw anga tua levut a ḍiḍi tu lima,' aya, łałak."
"'ko tjokoyavaw anga toa levot a dridri to lima,' aya, ljaljak."
S.TRANSL: “‘I’ll give five white pigs as compensation,’ she says, child.”

S.FORM: "iru ka ken a pukaui angata," aya ti Pułałułałuyan.
"iro ka ken a pokaoi angata," aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “I most certainly won’t agree,” said Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: vaik ti sa Lavułian a sema Pakuvadavaday.
vaik ti sa Lavoljian a sema Pakovadavaday.
S.TRANSL: Lavułian went back to the Pakuvadavaday house.

S.FORM: "inika pukaui a paraketj."
"inika pokaoi a paraketj."
S.TRANSL: “He continues not to agree.”

S.FORM: "tjuari, ku sazuaw anga sakamaya," aya ti Tjukutjuku.
"tjoari, ko sazoaw anga sakamaya," aya ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: “It can’t be helped(?); I’ll just go there myself,” said Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: kematsu tu qata tjanuita i kavatjes; saka avan a nanemanemanga sinu tjałavuluvulungan; sa vaik anga sema Vavuluvulungan ti Tjukutjuku.
kemaco to qata tjanoita i kavatjes; saka avan a nanemanemanga sino tjaljavolovolongan; sa vaik anga sema Vavolovolongan ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: She took a storage basket full of beads, and chose out all the oldest (most valuable) things. And so Tjukutjuku went to the Vavuluvulungan house.

S.FORM: qau sa pareputsekeł anga sakamaya.
qao sa parepocekelj anga sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: And in the end they were married.

S.FORM: saka izua, saka amin.
saka izoa, saka amin.
S.TRANSL: And that’s the end.
